TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
48 [Laurence.]
SE&ydot;nt laurence Laurence guod man was &punctelev; and in &slong;trong Mart&ydot;rdom martyrdom
he endede here on eo&rrot;þe is lijf &punctelev; and to þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heuene he com
Decius þe Aumperour &punctelev; þat luþur was inovȝ
And is Iu&slong;tise iustise
Valerian &punctelev; þat to alle schrewehede d&rrot;ovȝ
hu&ydot; wenden and souȝten cri&slong;tine Men men &punctelev; and ȝwane hu&ydot; enie founde
hu&ydot; pineden heom with gret to&rrot;ment &punctelev; and b&rrot;ouȝten heom sone to grounde
hu&ydot; comen[MS. comenen] and founden þene bischop sixte &punctelev; and aslowen him with gret wouȝ
Seint laurence Laurence was is Ercedeckne ercedeckne &punctelev; þat guod man was inovȝ
¶þo þe bischop scholde beon inome &punctelev; and he þat cas iseiȝ
Seint laurence Laurence is Ercedeckne ercedeckne &punctelev; he cleopede þat was him neiȝ
Al þat treso&rrot; of holie churche &punctelev; þat he togadere d&rrot;ovȝ
Seint laurence Laurence he it bitok &punctelev; to witien it wel inovȝ
þe to&rrot;mento&rrot;es þat þis iseiȝen &punctelev; heom boþe hu&ydot; nome fa&slong;te
Seint sixte and seint laurence Laurence &punctelev; and &slong;trongue biendes on heom ca&slong;te
hu&ydot; ladden seint sixte to heo&rrot;e false godes &punctelev; and is tweie felawes also
And scheweden heom heo&rrot;e false h&ydot;mages &punctelev; and beden heom aloute þarto
Þo þis guode men nolden don so &punctelev; ake on o&rrot;e louerd hu&ydot; crieden fa&slong;te
hu&ydot; smiten of heo&rrot;e heuedes sone &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e bodies þare ca&slong;te
Þe Aumperoure hu&ydot; senden wo&rrot;d &punctelev; al ȝwat hu&ydot; hadden ido
And hov seint
laurence Laurence in p&rrot;isone was &punctelev; in &slong;trongue bendes also
And hou he al þat treso&rrot; hadde &punctelev; of churchene to him id&rrot;awe.[A v. om.]
Þe Aumperov[r] iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; he was glad þarof and fawe
Fo&rrot; he þouȝte þat treso&rrot; al habbe &punctelev; þei it were aȝen lawe
¶Þane holie Man man he liet fette &punctelev; and bifo&rrot;e him lede
And biheold him wel &slong;tu&ydot;rneliche &punctelev; and wrotþeliche[MS. wo&rrot;tþeliche] to him sede
Ȝware is þat treso&rrot; of þe churchene &punctelev; þat þe was ib&rrot;ouȝt
Seint laurence Laurence &slong;tod wel &slong;tille &punctelev; and ne ansuerede[MS. ansueredede] him riȝt nouȝt
Þe Aumperour was swiþe wroth &punctelev; þo he ne ȝaf him non Answere answere
Anon he wolde habbe defouled him &punctelev; vnneþe he it[al. om.] niȝte fo&rrot;bere
he liet cleopie valerian &punctelev; þat was is heiȝe Iu&slong;tise iustise
Nim he seide þeosne Man man &punctelev; wel fa&slong;te in alle wise
And win of him þat treso&rrot; &punctelev; and make him don sacrefise
Oþur b&rrot;ing him in swuch to&rrot;ment &punctelev; þat oþure of him agrise
Þe Iu&slong;tise iustise nam þene holie Man man &punctelev; and liet him binde fa&slong;te
And bitok him &ydot;polite Ypolite þe kn&ydot;ȝt &punctelev; In &slong;trong p&rrot;isone to ca&slong;te
he b&rrot;ouȝte [him] in &slong;trong p&rrot;isoun &punctelev; and bilek him fa&slong;te also
with þeoues and with luþere Men men &punctelev; þat hadden þe Aumperoure misdo
On heþene man þare was Inne inne &punctelev; lucille Lucille was is name
Þat hadde þareinne so muche iwope &punctelev; fo&rrot; seo&rrot;uwe and fo&rrot; schame
Þat he weop out boþe is eiȝene &punctelev; and al bl&ydot;nd was bicome
Seint laurence Laurence hadde reuþe &punctelev; þat is siȝt him was binome
bilief he seide on Iesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat fo&rrot; us schedde is blod
And afong cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; ant þov schalt habbe þi siȝt wel guod
Ich bilieue þis oþur seide &punctelev; on him with al mi þouȝt
And fo&rrot;sake alle þeos false godes &punctelev; þat ne mowen me helpe nouȝt
¶Seint laurence Laurence baptizede him &punctelev; and anonriȝt with þe dede
his siȝt him cam wel cler and guod &punctelev; þo bigan he anon to grede
Ihered beo swete Iesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat here hath i·cud is miȝte
And þo&rrot;uȝ is seriaunt seint laurence Laurence &punctelev; me hath isent mi siȝte
Fo&rrot; ase ȝe wuten euerechone &punctelev; mi siȝt me was binome
And þo&rrot;uȝ Iesu cri&slong;t and seint laurence Laurence &punctelev; it is me aȝein icome
Þis t&ydot;þingue sp&rrot;ong sone wide &punctelev; so þat oþo&rrot;e inowe
Þat wide aboute blinde weren &punctelev; þuderward fa&slong;te hu&ydot; d&rrot;owe
¶Þo &ydot;polite Ypolite þis isaiȝ &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerd hadde swuch miȝte
Þat alle þe blinde þat þudere comen &punctelev; anon hadden heo&rrot;e siȝte
Merci he criede seint laurence Laurence " &punctelev; and to Iesu[MS. Iusu.]
cri&slong;t Crist him nam
And he and al is ma&ydot;nie &punctelev; nomen cri&slong;tinedom
Valerian þareafterward sone &punctelev; ase it cam in is þouȝte
Sende to &ydot;polite Ypolite þe kn&ydot;ȝt &punctelev; þat he seint laurence Laurence him b&rrot;ouȝte
Nov laurence Laurence quath &ydot;polite Ypolite &punctelev; fo&rrot;th ich mot þe lede
Ȝe go we fo&rrot;th seide laurence Laurence &punctelev; ne schal us noþing d&rrot;ede
Þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene is alȝare &punctelev; to us boþe in alle wise
Þo ladde &ydot;polite Ypolite
laurence Laurence fo&rrot;th &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e þe luþere Iu&slong;tise iustise
Valerian þe Iu&slong;tise iustise &punctelev; biheold laurence Laurence fa&slong;te
And seide bel ami hov longue &punctelev; schal ower folie ila&slong;te
Tu&ydot;rn þi þouȝt ich rede sone &punctelev; and schewe us þat tresour
Of churchene þat þe was bitake &punctelev; and deliuere it þe Aumperour
¶Sire Iu&slong;tise iustise seint laurence Laurence seide &punctelev; ȝif þov onder&slong;tan&slong;t resoun
Þov wo&slong;t wel þat ich habbe ile&ydot;e &punctelev; longue in þat p&rrot;isoun
So þat ine habbe nouȝt þat treso&rrot; &punctelev; of churche here nov ȝare
Ake ȝif me þreo dawes fur&slong;t &punctelev; þat ich mouwe aboute fare
And ich it wolle togadere b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; and here bifo&rrot;e þe lede
Þo was þe Iu&slong;tise iustise sw&ydot;þe glad &punctelev; of wo&rrot;des þat he sede
Fo&rrot; hope of[o&rrot;ig. op] þat grete treso&rrot; &punctelev; and fo&rrot; none oþur[MS. oþur þur] þingue
he ȝaf him respit of þreo dawes &punctelev; þat treso&rrot; fo&rrot;th to b&rrot;ingue
And bitok him &ydot;polite Ypolite in warde &punctelev; þat he him aȝein b&rrot;ouȝte
Fo&rrot;th hu&ydot; wenden wide aboute &punctelev; and guod treso&rrot; hu&ydot; souȝte
Alle þe men þat hu&ydot; miȝten finde &punctelev; þat pouere and feble were
In sicnesse oþur in miseise &punctelev; togadere hu&ydot; b&rrot;ouȝten þere
And in &ydot;politus Ypolitus house hudden heom &punctelev; And and wenden to þe Aumperour
Þe Aumperour heom Axede axede sone &punctelev; ȝware were þat tresour
¶Sire seide seint laurence Laurence &punctelev; redi it is anon
he wende out after þe selie Men men &punctelev; and bad heom with him gon
Into þe paleis[o&rrot;ig. palais] he ladde heom fo&rrot;th &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e þe Aumperour
Lo sire he seide ich habbe ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; holi churche tresour
Þis tresour is swiþe holi and guod &punctelev; and euere it wole ila&slong;te
hit ne schal neuere wanie &punctelev; ake euere wexe fa&slong;te
In eche londe it is redi &punctelev; ȝwodereso ani man wiende
Þarewith Man man ma&ydot; þe blisse of heouene &punctelev; bugge withouten ende."[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
Ei traitre seide þe Aumperour &punctelev; is it icome hereto
ha&slong;tþov us þus to sco&rrot;n id&rrot;iue? &punctelev; þov ne schalt nonmo&rrot;e so
he liet him &slong;treope nakede anon &punctelev; and with smarte scourgene him bete
Þat blod o&rrot;n bi is limes adoun &punctelev; boþe in lengþe and in grete (!)
Þo seide þis holie man &punctelev; louerd ich þonkie þe
Þat among þine holie compa&ydot;nie &punctelev; þi wille is to b&rrot;ingue me
And þov wrechche luþere þing &punctelev; þov art in gret to&rrot;ment iwis
In wrathþe and so&rrot;uwe of heo&rrot;te &punctelev; and neuere þe wo&rrot;se me nis
A tra&ydot;tour seide þis luþere Man man &punctelev; neltþov nonoþur singue
Alle manere of to&rrot;menz &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e him he liet b&rrot;ingue
Hokes of . Ire ire . and ȝweoles also &punctelev; with raso&rrot;es alaboute
And a bed of Ire ire with kene pikes &punctelev; al b&rrot;enninde withoute
Scourgene of led and raketeiȝes &punctelev; and oþere wel mani on
Þat we ne conne nouȝt alle tellen &punctelev; on eo&rrot;þe nouþe nis swuch non
Lo seide þe Aumperour &punctelev; bihold nouþe alaboute
And honovre o&rrot;e godes ich rede anon &punctelev; oþur herto þov schalt loute;[al. route]
Fo&rrot; alle þe to&rrot;menz þat þov isixt &punctelev; and ȝeot wel mo þerto
bote þov tu&ydot;rne þi þouȝt anon &punctelev; on þi bodi schullen beo ido
¶Þov wrechche seide þis holie man &punctelev; mi wille hath euere ibeo
Fo&rrot;to come to þis murie solas &punctelev; þat ich here nouþe iseo
Wel mo to&rrot;menz þane here beoth &punctelev; to þe beoth imad alȝare
In þe pine of helle &punctelev; ȝwane ich schal to þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heuene fare
Decius þe Aumperour þo &punctelev; fierde ase he were wod
Þe compa&ydot;nie of to&rrot;mento&rrot;es &punctelev; wel p&rrot;e&slong;t bifo&rrot;e him &slong;tod
he het heom with grete &slong;taues &punctelev; leggen on him to grounde
Þe to&rrot;mento&rrot;es leiden on him &punctelev; and maden him mani a wounde
Ase hu&ydot; beoten þis holie bodi &punctelev; seint laurence Laurence him sede
Þou wrechche nouþe þov miȝt iseo &punctelev; þat Inabbe of þe no d&rrot;ede
Nimez anon quath þe Aumperour &punctelev; and makiez is to&rrot;ment mo&rrot;e
Wel redie weren þe schrewes alle &punctelev; to don aftur is lo&rrot;e
Irene plates al b&rrot;enninde &punctelev; In is woundes hu&ydot; duden so so&rrot;e
Swete louerd þis holi man seide &punctelev; ich bidde þe milce and o&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; þo ich was harde acoupet &punctelev; Ine fo&rrot;sok þe nouȝt
Ake þo me Axeden axeden me ich was aknowe of þe &punctelev; with wo&rrot;de and with þouȝt
Þo decius Decius iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; fo&rrot; wrathþe he gan grede
And liet nime scourgene &punctelev; with grete bottene[al. battes] of lede
And liet beten þis holi man &punctelev; þat is bones b&rrot;eken some
Þat he was opon þe pointe of deth &punctelev; and is &slong;trencþe neiȝ binome
¶Louerd he seide Iesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat þolede&slong;t deth [fo&rrot;[added later] me
Onderfong ȝwane ich heonnes wiende &punctelev; mine soule ich bidde þe
Þo cam þare a swete voiz &punctelev; adoun fram heuene anon
Þat þeos wo&rrot;des to him seide &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; heo&rrot;den echon
Ȝeot þe beoth fo&rrot; godes Godes loue &punctelev; to&rrot;mentes[MS. to&rrot;mento&rrot;es] to come wel mo
¶Þo Decius iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; fo&rrot; wrathþe he gradde and wo
Lo he seide mine barones &punctelev; þat mi conseileres ȝe beoth
Conseil nimez hereof[al. To con|seile me] in mine court &punctelev; of þingue þat ȝe iseoth
Ȝe iheo&rrot;ez wel hov þe deuele[n] &punctelev; with him spekez nov here
Fo&rrot; of þing þat ȝe iheo&rrot;ez alle &punctelev; he ne ma&ydot; him nouȝt skere
hu&ydot; comieth here and confo&rrot;tiez him &punctelev; ase ȝe iheo&rrot;ez echon
Strong wichche [he] is þat ne doutez &punctelev; of o&rrot;e godes echon
Wel hardi he is fo&rrot; he ne tellez &punctelev; of alle o&rrot;e to&rrot;menz non
bi þe fei þat ich owe to mahun &punctelev; anoþur it schal gon
Scourgene he liet nime of Ire &punctelev; þat harde weren inovȝ
And is flesch þat was er bileued &punctelev; þarewith he[al. me] tognovȝ
Þo is flesch þus defouled was &punctelev; þat reovþe it was to seo
Þeof he seide ȝeot þov schalt &punctelev; In wel mo&rrot;e to&rrot;ment beo
his chekene and is mouth aboute &punctelev; he liet[MS. liete] bete with &slong;tones
And daschte þe tiez out of is heued &punctelev; and tob&rrot;eken is bones
Þov wrechche he seide biþiench þiseolf &punctelev; and to&rrot;ne sone þi þouȝt
¶Sire Aumperour laurence Laurence seide &punctelev; þov spext al embe nouȝt
Inelle honovri none oþur godes &punctelev; þane Iesus in none wise
Fo&rrot; him ich louie and euere wolle &punctelev; don him sacrefise
Þo Decius him hadde ido &punctelev; al þat he couþe biþenche
Certes he seide þov schalt beo ded &punctelev; ne schaltþov nouȝt so at|blenche
Strong fu&ydot;r he lieth maken and gret &punctelev; and a gredire þaron sette
Þene holie Man man seint laurence Laurence &punctelev; þarto he liet fette
And alalong opon þe gredire &punctelev; ouer þe fure him ca&slong;te
Þe to&rrot;mento&rrot;es &slong;toden alaboute &punctelev; and bleowen þat fu&ydot;r wel fa&slong;te
with Irene irene pikes hu&ydot; pulten him &punctelev; and schouen In[al. him] fa&slong;te aboue
Louerd muche was þe p&ydot;ne &punctelev; þat he soffrede fo&rrot; þi loue
Þat fu&ydot;r bineoþe ro&slong;tede him &punctelev; al quic mid flesch and blode
And þe Irene irene pikes in is flesch &punctelev; ful bitterliche hu&ydot; wode
Seint laurence Laurence bigan to speke [þo] &punctelev; and to þe Aumpero&rrot;e he sede
Þov luþere wrechche it ne deriez me nouȝt &punctelev; al þine luþere dede
Nim ȝeme þat þine fu&ydot;rie coles &punctelev; wel muche akelez me
And into þe &slong;trongue fu&ydot;re of helle &punctelev; hu&ydot; schullen b&rrot;ingue þe
LOuerd Iesu cri&slong;t Crist þov it wo&slong;t &punctelev; Ine habbe þe nouȝt fo&rrot;sake
Ake clanliche mi bodi and al mi þouȝt &punctelev; þe ich habbe bitake
Þo biheold he þene Aumperour &punctelev; with fair semblaunt and louvȝ
Þov wrechche he seide þou ha&slong;t iro&slong;ted &punctelev; þulke one side inouȝ
To&rrot;ne hire opward and .et. hire nouþe &punctelev; fo&rrot; ȝare heo is þareto
And wiend and ro&slong;te þat oþur side &punctelev; þat heo beo inovȝ also."[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
¶Þo biheold he up on heiȝ &punctelev; and toward heouene is E&ydot;ene ca&slong;te
And seide &punctelev; swete Iesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; Ich þonki þe wel fa&slong;te
Þat ich it habbe ofserued &punctelev; at þine ȝates In in to wiende
With þulke wo&rrot;de he deide þo &punctelev; and b&rrot;oute is lijf to ende.[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
&ydot;polit þe guode kn&ydot;ȝt &punctelev; þat he b&rrot;ouȝte to cri&slong;tinedom
And þat him wu&slong;te in p&rrot;isone .er &punctelev; sw&ydot;þe so&rrot;i bicom
bi niȝte he wende &slong;tilledeliche &punctelev; and þis holie bodi he nom
And burede hit wel &slong;tilledeliche &punctelev; after is harde dom
Louerd muche was þe pine &punctelev; þat he þolede here
hit[MS. his] is wel riȝt þat he beo &punctelev; Apo&slong;tles ifere
Novþe Iesu fo&rrot; þe grete pine &punctelev; þat seint laurence Laurence here hadde
Vs b&rrot;ingue to þulke Io&ydot;e ioye &punctelev; þat þine Aungels aungels his soule ladde Amen
